sense.name: a sum of money gambled
sense.examples: The bookies are taking bets for the next horse race. He placed a bet on red on the roulette wheel. This table has a minimum bet of $100.

sense.name: the act of gambling, making a wager
sense.commentary: BET[+event][+undertaking_risk][+high][+for_reward] Note: often implies a monetary reward, but can be extended to include other risk/reward situations.
sense.examples: He ate ten hot dogs on a bet. She is too young to make a bet in the casino. The bet of starting his own Internet game company finally paid off. The general couldn't make such a bet with the lives of so many troops at stake.

sense.name: a choice, a course of action
sense.examples: Your best bet would be to call a professional exterminator. It seemed like a better bet to drive to the cape after the rush hour traffic.

sense.name: a personal opinion
sense.examples: My bet is that the president will veto the bill. What's your best bet as to how long this project will take?

sense.name: Idiom
sense.examples: At this point all bets are off as to who will win the playoffs.
